Browse the source code of netbsd/external/bsd/jemalloc/include/jemalloc/internal/jemalloc_internal_types.h

1#ifndef JEMALLOC_INTERNAL_TYPES_H
2#define JEMALLOC_INTERNAL_TYPES_H
3
4/* Page size index type. */
5typedef unsigned pszind_t;
6
7/* Size class index type. */
8typedef unsigned szind_t;
9
10/* Processor / core id type. */
11typedef int malloc_cpuid_t;
12
13/*
14 * Flags bits:
15 *
16 * a: arena
17 * t: tcache
18 * 0: unused
19 * z: zero
20 * n: alignment
21 *
22 * aaaaaaaa aaaatttt tttttttt 0znnnnnn
23 */
24#define MALLOCX_ARENA_BITS 12
25#define MALLOCX_TCACHE_BITS 12
26#define MALLOCX_LG_ALIGN_BITS 6
27#define MALLOCX_ARENA_SHIFT 20
28#define MALLOCX_TCACHE_SHIFT 8
29#define MALLOCX_ARENA_MASK \
30 (((1 << MALLOCX_ARENA_BITS) - 1) << MALLOCX_ARENA_SHIFT)
31/* NB: Arena index bias decreases the maximum number of arenas by 1. */
32#define MALLOCX_ARENA_LIMIT ((1 << MALLOCX_ARENA_BITS) - 1)
33#define MALLOCX_TCACHE_MASK \
34 (((1 << MALLOCX_TCACHE_BITS) - 1) << MALLOCX_TCACHE_SHIFT)
35#define MALLOCX_TCACHE_MAX ((1 << MALLOCX_TCACHE_BITS) - 3)
36#define MALLOCX_LG_ALIGN_MASK ((1 << MALLOCX_LG_ALIGN_BITS) - 1)
37/* Use MALLOCX_ALIGN_GET() if alignment may not be specified in flags. */
38#define MALLOCX_ALIGN_GET_SPECIFIED(flags) \
39 (ZU(1) << (flags & MALLOCX_LG_ALIGN_MASK))
40#define MALLOCX_ALIGN_GET(flags) \
41 (MALLOCX_ALIGN_GET_SPECIFIED(flags) & (SIZE_T_MAX-1))
42#define MALLOCX_ZERO_GET(flags) \
43 ((bool)(flags & MALLOCX_ZERO))
44
45#define MALLOCX_TCACHE_GET(flags) \
46 (((unsigned)((flags & MALLOCX_TCACHE_MASK) >> MALLOCX_TCACHE_SHIFT)) - 2)
47#define MALLOCX_ARENA_GET(flags) \
48 (((unsigned)(((unsigned)flags) >> MALLOCX_ARENA_SHIFT)) - 1)
49
50/* Smallest size class to support. */
51#define TINY_MIN (1U << LG_TINY_MIN)
52
53/*
54 * Minimum allocation alignment is 2^LG_QUANTUM bytes (ignoring tiny size
55 * classes).
56 */
57#ifndef LG_QUANTUM
58# if (defined(__i386__) || defined(_M_IX86))
59# define LG_QUANTUM 4
60# endif
61# ifdef __ia64__
62# define LG_QUANTUM 4
63# endif
64# ifdef __alpha__
65# define LG_QUANTUM 4
66# endif
67# ifdef __sparc__
68# define LG_QUANTUM 4
69# endif
70# if (defined(__amd64__) || defined(__x86_64__) || defined(_M_X64))
71# define LG_QUANTUM 4
72# endif
73# ifdef __arm__
74# define LG_QUANTUM 3
75# endif
76# ifdef __aarch64__
77# define LG_QUANTUM 4
78# endif
79# ifdef __hppa__
80# define LG_QUANTUM 4
81# endif
82# ifdef __m68k__
83# define LG_QUANTUM 3
84# endif
85# ifdef __mips__
86# define LG_QUANTUM 3
87# endif
88# ifdef __nios2__
89# define LG_QUANTUM 3
90# endif
91# ifdef __or1k__
92# define LG_QUANTUM 3
93# endif
94# ifdef __powerpc__
95# define LG_QUANTUM 4
96# endif
97# if defined(__riscv) || defined(__riscv__)
98# define LG_QUANTUM 4
99# endif
100# ifdef __sh3__
101# define LG_QUANTUM 3
102# endif
103# ifdef __s390__
104# define LG_QUANTUM 4
105# endif
106# if (defined (__SH3E__) || defined(__SH4_SINGLE__) || defined(__SH4__) || \
107 defined(__SH4_SINGLE_ONLY__))
108# define LG_QUANTUM 4
109# endif
110# ifdef __tile__
111# define LG_QUANTUM 4
112# endif
113# ifdef __le32__
114# define LG_QUANTUM 4
115# endif
116# ifdef __vax__
117# define LG_QUANTUM 4
118# endif
119# ifndef LG_QUANTUM
120# error "Unknown minimum alignment for architecture; specify via "
121 "--with-lg-quantum"
122# endif
123#endif
124
125#define QUANTUM ((size_t)(1U << LG_QUANTUM))
126#define QUANTUM_MASK (QUANTUM - 1)
127
128/* Return the smallest quantum multiple that is >= a. */
129#define QUANTUM_CEILING(a) \
130 (((a) + QUANTUM_MASK) & ~QUANTUM_MASK)
131
132#define LONG ((size_t)(1U << LG_SIZEOF_LONG))
133#define LONG_MASK (LONG - 1)
134
135/* Return the smallest long multiple that is >= a. */
136#define LONG_CEILING(a) \
137 (((a) + LONG_MASK) & ~LONG_MASK)
138
139#define SIZEOF_PTR (1U << LG_SIZEOF_PTR)
140#define PTR_MASK (SIZEOF_PTR - 1)
141
142/* Return the smallest (void *) multiple that is >= a. */
143#define PTR_CEILING(a) \
144 (((a) + PTR_MASK) & ~PTR_MASK)
145
146/*
147 * Maximum size of L1 cache line. This is used to avoid cache line aliasing.
148 * In addition, this controls the spacing of cacheline-spaced size classes.
149 *
150 * CACHELINE cannot be based on LG_CACHELINE because __declspec(align()) can
151 * only handle raw constants.
152 */
153#define LG_CACHELINE 6
154#define CACHELINE 64
155#define CACHELINE_MASK (CACHELINE - 1)
156
157/* Return the smallest cacheline multiple that is >= s. */
158#define CACHELINE_CEILING(s) \
159 (((s) + CACHELINE_MASK) & ~CACHELINE_MASK)
160
161/* Return the nearest aligned address at or below a. */
162#define ALIGNMENT_ADDR2BASE(a, alignment) \
163 ((void *)((uintptr_t)(a) & ((~(alignment)) + 1)))
164
165/* Return the offset between a and the nearest aligned address at or below a. */
166#define ALIGNMENT_ADDR2OFFSET(a, alignment) \
167 ((size_t)((uintptr_t)(a) & (alignment - 1)))
168
169/* Return the smallest alignment multiple that is >= s. */
170#define ALIGNMENT_CEILING(s, alignment) \
171 (((s) + (alignment - 1)) & ((~(alignment)) + 1))
172
173/* Declare a variable-length array. */
174#if __STDC_VERSION__ < 199901L
175# ifdef _MSC_VER
176# include <malloc.h>
177# define alloca _alloca
178# else
179# ifdef JEMALLOC_HAS_ALLOCA_H
180# include <alloca.h>
181# else
182# include <stdlib.h>
183# endif
184# endif
185# define VARIABLE_ARRAY(type, name, count) \
186 type *name = alloca(sizeof(type) * (count))
187#else
188# define VARIABLE_ARRAY(type, name, count) type name[(count)]
189#endif
190
191#endif /* JEMALLOC_INTERNAL_TYPES_H */
192
